div.p: Frederick McCoy to Robert Brough Smyth
Outward letter book 2, no. 62/148, Museum of Victoria, Melbourne.

I h. the h. to ack. the rect of yr letter
i.e. I have the honour to acknowledge the receipt of your letter …. of the 28th July informing me that a Board had been nominated by the Hon. the Chief Sec. to consider and report on the subject of the contemplated removal from the colony of the Meteorite found at Cranbourne and that I had been nominated one of the members of that Board of which the Hon. C. S. Evans was the Chairman and further informing me that on account of Dr Evan's temporary absence from the Colony he postponed summoning the Board until his return to Melbourne when he would cause the Board to be summoned.

I h. the h. to state that in reply that I will take care that the wishes of the Minister shall be made known to any persons undetaking the removal of the meteroite and as far as may be permitted to me I will see that they are complied with and that no steps shall be taken in the matter without notice being sent to Dr Evans thereof
